values: Holy crap. 2009. Does anyone still read this? Find me on Facebook, yo!

I haven't written anything since last year.  Yeah I'm workin' at Discount Tire Company on Albemarle road near Harrisburg road.  No...I can't give you a discount (ironically...).

So...I noticed some folks using Bellsouth and some using Alltel are coming here....YET NOT COMMENTING.  If you're gonna come by and stalk me yet not tell me you were here...I'll be upset.  I can tell who's been visiting this Mofo' and want you to say something.  Not you Courtney...

Courtney and I are great.  We had a great Christmas.  I ordered an Xbox 360 last week...it should be here tomorrow...HOPEFULLY.  I start my spring semester at UNCC too.  No Friday classes...woot!  I have three day weekends til summer!

I don't feel like typing no mores :p

Right now marks the 1st year, 1st month, 9th day, 9th hour and 45th minute I've been in love with Courtney. Over that whole year and some odd days, there have been times where we have shared many happy moments, many romantic moments, and unfortunatly some less-than-happy moments. But if someone were to offer me everything I wanted and in return they want my future with Courtney, I'd tell them that I already have everything I want and it lies in what they want from me. We both know that I have been a horrible lover to her sometimes, and I'm writing this to apologize for that. I want her to know that everytime she's thought I don't care about her, don't want to be with her, don't want anything to do with her, I've always felt so stupid for that and can only wish that I can tell her how much she means to me. I made the decision a long time ago that I'm done looking. I don't want anyone else. Everything I want she has. She has shown me what a perfect girlfriend is like, and what kind of a life I can expect from a girl of her caliber. I feel pride knowing that people associate me with her. At Arby's, where I used to work, everyone associated her with me. She came in a couple times, too, before a concert and honestly knocked the guys flat on their asses. I can only imagine what kind of an impact she'd make at Discount Tire where the only people that work there are guys. I can only think of one thing to sum up how I feel in one short sentence: I love Courtney Guthrie with every ounce of me.

Hmm....been a while. For those who still read this, here ya go: I got a new diesel truck, K? Since were switching my truck's body onto that one's chassis, I was working on the new truck's body. (The "new" truck is actually 3 years older) I was standing on a chest thing in our garage to reach a creeper, those things that you lay on and slide under cars, on the top shelf. I jumped back down but caught the brick step leading to the door to our house in the garage. Initially I thought it was a bruise. Then I figured it was a busted blood vessel. I let it go while I was at work. When I got home, it had grown a small bit. I took my nail clippers and made a TINY incision to let the blood out, to avoid clotting. After I mopped the gushing blood (I.e. dripping onto a tissue for like 30 seconds. Slowly.) , I hydrogen peroxided it and put a non Band-Aid brand band-aid on. All better :) BTW, if you didn't know I worked at Arby's, I do. The one at Lawyers and Wilson Grove/Lebanon/Margaret Wallace. The one across from Independence High School. Come visit me, I work evenings mainly. Text me if you wanna confirm I'm working that night (704-724-9076). Abuse that number and die. Yes, Courtney and I are fine. Any other questions? Comment!

So I've officially been accepted to all three colleges I applied to.  Queens, Western Carolina, and UNC-Charlotte.  I believe I'm going to end up going to Charlotte.  Wooooooie!

BTW Courtney and I rock.  We're still together.  Mmmmhmmmmmm.  6 Months on the 24th.  Working on my longest relationship evarrrr. Wooooo.

If you could only see the way she loves me
Then maybe you would understand
Why I feel this way about our love
And what I must do
If you could only see how blue her eyes can be when she says
When she says she loves me

I won't insult your knowledge. You know where I am now. Glad to be here. On the way home however, I beleive I was traumatized. If you read in the news about a horrible motorcycle accident on 485 near Harrisburg road, I was about 2 minutes behind it. I was driving and I pulled up to what I thought was a shoe thrown from an accident. There was part of the motorcycles dude leg still in it. I had to stop and switch driving with my dad because he was more experienced and could get us through the cars and whatnot, but I walked about a foot (no pun intended) from that severed limb. I ended up parking next to it because I had to, and my dad had to jump over it and I had to walk right next to it. Folks I was staring at about 15 inches of foot and bloody bone. The dude was laying on the side of the road further up with his legless zone tourniqetted and his other leg broken horrible. The hell of it all is that him and his buddy passed me about 15 minutes earlier, not speeding or anything. So yeah, I saw a guy in two parts. In person. Eerie... Anyways...here's some badass pictures of the Niagara falls....and some of me. Brad and Me on the side of the Erie Canal. He's my brother and is almost 12 if you didn't know. The American side of the Niagara Falls, from Canada, 520 feet in the air. That's ice on the rocks and stuff, but whitewater on the river up top. Same angle of the Canadian, "Horseshoe" Falls. My hair is from the amazing amount of wind...it's not always that ugly amazingly. Taken from a observation thing connected to tunnels that travel under/behind the falls. Very cool.

Hey ya'll, I'm just up here in Buffalo at my grampa's house.  Yesterday was officially 5 months that Courtney and I have been dating.  It's also her longest relationship so far.  I hope to keep that record.  Unfortunatly, it's not mine, but we're working on that.  I love her to deeeeeeeath and can't wait to see her again once I get home.  Courtney, when you read this, I love you and you'll be the first one I want to/will see when I get home.  I can't wait to hug and kiss you.  Mmmmm...

A girl asked a guy if he thought she was pretty... he said no.
She asked him if he would want to be with her forever... and he said no.
She then asked him if she were to leave would he cry, and once again he replied with a no.
She had heard enough.

As she walked away, tears streaming down her face the boy grabbed her arm and said...
You're not pretty, you're beautiful.
I don't want to be with you forever. I need to be with you forever.
And I wouldn't cry if you walked away... I'd die.
I'm giving blood tomorrow.  Woo.  Any one want a pint o' my juice?

Tomorrow marks 4 months that Courtney and I have been dating. You know that whole...being on your best behaviors most girls act like for the first month or so, then stop acting like they care and get a case of the "me me me" complex like Mrs. Michael says...all cause it's not how they want the guy to act? She hasn't grown out of that. She's still acting like she loves me. I love it! I love her! Do we have the perfect relationship? Yes. What's wrong with it? Honestly...what? We love eachother for personality...and we think the other looks awesomely sexy. Looks are important, I don't care who you are. But her personality is what really makes her shine. I don't know why I didn't realize this so long ago when we first became friends. I don't feel scared to tell her things because maybe what she believes will get in the way...or maybe she'll find it immature or whatever. Nah, none of that...she acts her age. I love it. She's not stupid by any stretch of the imagination either. She's smarter than me and I admit that hands down. I don't feel dumb when I talk to her....but she's got booksmarts and...the other kind of smarts. And she loves the exact same music! Wahoo. It's hard to stop writing good things about her...

I'm just putting a valentine's thing up.  I want to tell my girlfriend how much I appreciate her and what she's done for me.  She may or may not know what kind of a person I'm beyond glad she is.  She's made me so happy these last 3.5 months we've been dating, and I can only hope for many many many more.  If I had to fill out a little survey that asked me what I wanted in a girl then it gave me the combination of my answers, she's my result.  She's helped me be truely me.  I'm not afraid to tell her anything because it might offend her.  I'm not afraid to talk to her because she might snap back at me or something.  She's the nicest, sweetest, most wonderful person to be around and you can ask anyone who I talk to/hang out with.  I love to be with her and I love to invite her places.  She shows me she loves me where we're out together, even though we aren't hanging off eachother every second we're together.  And even though we aren't attached at the hip...we're definitely attached at the brain.  We know exactly what the other is thinking without really talking to them much.  I know I probably get on her nerves a bit, but I know she forgives me and I know she loves me no matter what.  That's true love folks.

So, with that, Happy Valentine's day, thank you, and I love you Courtney.

1 Corinthians 13:4-8 "Love is patient, love is kind. It does not envy, it does not boast, it is not proud. It is not rude, it is not self-seeking, it is not easily angered, it keeps no record of wrongs. Love does not delight in evil but rejoices with the truth. It always protects, always trusts, always hopes, always perseveres. Love never fails." Just a little early Valentine's Day thing..

Man.  I never thought my dad would ever get like this.  Here's the problem:  he's tired of paying for gas.  It comes out to like 150-200 dollars a month.  Thats a crazy amount to be spending.  My idea is to sell the truck and get an older diesel for great mileage.  I can get an old Mercedes diesel in great condition for what my truck is worth.  Great reputation, awesome comfort and reliability, great mileage, actually cheaper to buy than my truck probably.  My dad doesn't want to.  I assume it's because he wants to keep the truck because it's cool.  The reasons that's a horrible reason are: he never drives it, if he needs to pull something hes got a healthy diesel Liberty, he doesn't like driving it, it's not very comfortable.  It's a no brainer to sell that truck and get something cheaper and better on gas.  But no...he won't do it.  I guess I need to talk to him tomorrow.

I'm so annoyed...things started to suck tonight very fast once I asked him about it.

Yeeeeah I got my truck back. 650 CFM carburetor, 2201 performer series intake, yadda yadda. It's cool, and it runs great. Now my dad reaaaaally wants me to get a job haha. He's tired of paying for gas for it. Anyone know anywhere cool I can work? I also ordered a pirate flag for it. Hehe. That should be in by like...Friday or Saturday. Clean...

I'm gonna grow my hair out just a bit longer than it is now. Maybe a couple more inches...any opinions? Also...I delivered the final part for my truck today. Hopefully I can have it Friday or Saturday. That thing will be an absolute beast. It'll be an Edelbrock from the intake up. 500 CFM Thunder Series AVS carb, Performer 2101 intake, stylish air cleaner. Folks, I'm happy. Hehehe now you know you want to ride in that.

I know it's mighty late, but who cares?  This is an awesome Christmas Poem.


'Twas the night before Christmas, and out in the garage,
There wasn't a trace of a Ford, Toyota, or Dodge.

The presents were wrapped, and the lights were all lit,
So I figured I'd mess, with the Silverado a bit.

I popped the release, and I lifted the hood,
When a deep voice behind me said, "looks pretty good."

Well as you can imagine, I turned mighty quick,
And there by the workbench, stood good ol Saint Nick!

We stood there a bit, not too sure what to say,
Then he said "don't suppose that you'd trade for my sleigh?"

I said "no way Santa", and started to grin,
"But if you've got the time, we could go for a spin!"

His round little mouth, all tied up like a bow,
Turned into a smile and he said, "Hey! Let's go!!"

So as not to disturb, all the neighbors' retreat,
We pushed the Silverado, quietly out to the street.

Then taking our places, to drift down the hill,
I turned on the key, and I let the clutch spill.

The sound that erupted, took him by surprise,
But he liked it a lot, by the look in his eyes.

With the tires a' cryin', and exhaust pipes aglow,
We headed out where, the hot rodders go.

And Santa's grin widened, approaching his ears,
With every shift up, as I went through the gears.

Then Santa yelled, "I've never felt so alive!"
So I backed off the gas, and said "you wanna drive?"

Ol Santa was stunned, when I gave him the keys,
When he walked past the headlights, he shook at the knees!

The Big block exploded, with dual exhaust sound!
Santa let out the clutch and the tires shook the ground!

Power shift into second, again into third!
I sat there just watching, a loss for a word.


Then I heard him exclaim, as we blasted from sight,

"Merry Christmas to all...........have a hell of a night!!!"

I ordered a new toy tonight :)  I had the money...and a gift card...so I ordered one of these.  In...a while..I'll own a motherfucking light sabre!!!

I'm such a nerd.

<url>http://www.amazon.com/exec/obidos/tg/detail/-/B0007PHN30/103-3117042-2556652?%5Fencoding=UTF8&v=glance</url>

A silly sense of "Holy shit" bubbled up through me when I tested my late-arriving Christmas present on my room's stereo system. Folks, that's a 1000 watt, 12 inch subwoofer speaker. That thing almost dwarfs my guitar. It's bigger than my head, which, is saying quite a lot. I'm hooking that bad boy up in my truck whenever I get the other supplies (amp, wire, box). By the way, make fun of the comforter design and experience a very, very painful death. You've been warned.

It's 2006.  Woo.

Tonight was a blast!  I headed over to courtney's about 3:15 and stayed 'til like...12:30.  We pretty much farted about until it got close to midnight.  We had balloons, silly string, confetti poppers, and "champagne" ready.  I finally had someone to kiss for new year's, too :).  Tonight we all played Life.  Since there weren't enough cars, Courtney and I shared one.  It might only have been a game, but I found it very cute when we were talking about my career as a country entertainer making 80,000 a year.  We had one girl, Belle, and adopted two boys, Bill and Eddie.  We all lived on a farm house.  While just a game, again, I still thought it was nice pretending to be living like that.  I so can picture Courtney and me living like that, not to jinx it or anything.  Man, why is she so...awesome?  I can't think of one word to describe her.  Pretty much every positive word.

I think she's been pretty amazed as to why I'm so nice to her and her family.  Now don't get me wrong, I want to be known for being nice, but I think her family deserves more than that.  They've been through a lot and get a lot of crap.  They're very nice people and that gets taken advantage of sometimes.  The least they deserve is people to be nice to them.

So how is everyone?  I'm doing fine, thanks!  I couldn't be happier with Courtney.  At all.  Seriously.  I'm glad I have someone who deserves to be respected and appreciates me and what I like.  I keep telling her there's nothing I've found about her I hate.  She makes me happy on many levels.  Except when I laugh and talk :p haha.  Then I do all the work.  Just kiddinggggg heehee

SO everyone get cool stuff for Christmas?  I got a sexy steering wheel, two 12 inch subwoofers (speakers that are a foot wide, people), an amp, and we're going to get an old engine to rebuild.  Yeah.  It rocks to be me right about now.

This one works better...

Oh...our love is beautiful
Oh...oo...oh...Isn't it beautiful?
Times have changed
But you remain
My everything
Our Love is Beautiful
Stood by my side
Helped me survive
My great Divide
Isn't this is beautiful.

You set me free!
To live my life
You became my reason to survive the great divide
You set me free!

So I'll say why don't you and I,
Get together and take on the world and be together forever,
Heads we will, Tails we'll try again,
So I'll say why don't you and I,
Hold each other and fly to the moon and straight on to heaven,
Cause without you they're never gonna let me in.

All is well.  Courtney and I went shopping for our secret santas (we know eachothers haha...).  After we saw Dina in the parking lot, we went to my house for a while til she (had to) go home.  I think we watched The Simpsons, but I don't remember. Haha...we're such clean children.  Oh well.  I want ice cream.

Grr...this weekend just sucked. Friday night I went to a Checkers game with Caitlin and Lisa and Caitlin's family and it was really fun and all. Later on we all went to Caitlin's house and met Laura, Bobby and Courtney. Unfortunatly my dad managed to set the perfect curfew where I only got to see her for like 10 minutes. I did, however, tell them about Courtney and me, so they know. Today, though, was pretty bad. I ended up sitting around the morning 'til Courtney got home. She was supposed to come right over here after her little key club thing, but her brother was really sick. She had to stay there for a bit then we met up at the place where we were going to do our holiday concert for my guitar school. We barely managed to practice at all. The thing ran late. We didn't do so hot. She was scared. And since it was so late, our plans of going to her house were foiled because her mom was mad she wasn't home at 5. She understood our time of being there of 3:30 as what time we went on. We didn't go on until 6:30. So I'm really pissed off right now because of fucking laws not letting me drive after 9, just in case her mom does ease up. I'm really hoping that stupid transmission in the old jeep comes out okay so she can spend her day there. I really want to see her for a while this weekend. I also owe Lisa like 20 dollars because my dad snapped and won't give me money anymore. It's not my fault Autobell won't interview me and start paying me. Why can't life always be good?

I saw this quote line once in a Porsche ad in a magazine a while ago:

"Over 1.1 million words in the English language, and not one of them can describe the feeling."

Although it may apply to driving the car, it also seems to apply to my relationship life.  I honestly can't believe it is what it is.  I've never been so open and so trusting and so confident with any girl before Courtney.  Humor is such a big part of our relationship, it's not even funny.  No, wait, yes it is.  Poor thing is sick right now with strep throat.  Luckily her doctor said she should be over it within the next couple days.

BTW I've got a parking pass now, if anyone wants a ride and didn't want to walk way out to my truck before, provided I have gas.  Any guys should take me up on that offer because, well, the truck is simply a chick magnet.  If you're in need of some action you can probably ride in my truck, point at a girl, and score some booty.  It's that easy.  I won't even charge you.  Well maybe I will...unless you just use my truck for transportation needs.

It's secret santa time again. I'm glad we did it early cause I need time find a present for this individual. Oh well. In other news: my truck. I think the transmission is on it's last leg. I stopped just outside of my driveway to scrape more ice off this morning. When I shifted into park I heard it make a somewhat loud metallic banging noise, which isn't normal. When I left that spot, there was definite gear whine, which also isn't good. Anyone know someone with a wicked TH400 they don't want? I could use a bulletproof three-speed in the Juan Jeremy. Besides school, I think I have it made. A truck cooler than anyone else's, I might be getting a job at a car service station (meaning I get paid for working on cars), some of the best friends again, and last but certainly not least, the world's greatest girlfriend. I now realize what I've wanted in a girlfriend because of Courtney. Woo! She's kept me sane and happy constantly. It's so cool. Which segways into school. Senioritis. I believe that sums it up. I've concluded my three classes I might could do without: English, Statistics, and Bible. Why Bible? Because that class is a whole buncha worship and stuff. I thought they weren't supposed to do that. Anyways...I hope everyone is having a wonderful holiday season. By the way...I benched 190 today suckers! While not much, it's nearing my goal of 200+...woopie! Last thing: what my truck is capable of...while I doubt it's ability now that it's rather crippled from that blast in 27 degree weather. I might get one of the truck actually smoking some rubber soon.

Don't forget to visit my Car Domain.

http://www.cardomain.com/ride/2167152

Put your car on there, if you have one.
If anyone wants a ride home from school (I'm not picking anyone up, sorry) tell me.  Just be prepared to walk about 15-20 minutes to my truck.

Oh man!  Tonight was SO fun!  It was just Caitlin, Laura and Courtney and me at Caitlin's new house...but holy shiat...that was FUUUUUUN!  We roasted wienies, sat around the fire and made s'mores.  For the last 45 minutes we stayed in the jacuzzi.  It was fun every minute.  Laura's marshmellow becoming engulfed, playing with our wieners, touching eachother's wieners...it was all great.  The jacuzzi was sooooo comfortable and so fun.  Oh how I missed those guys.  Ohhhh how I missed them...
I got my license! I got my license! Anyone wanna ride?...before 9 of course haha...

This update contains 32 pictures of many different cars at the Auto Show. Ken and I walked around. It was a blast. If you have dial-up, go get something to eat, or go get a book, this will take a while. I included the make and model as best my memory serves me, so don't ask unless I didn't say it! Dodge Ram SRT-10 Yeah, it's packing a Viper engine. Dodge Viper I'm adorable and you love it. Chevrolet Corvette Z06 He's purty. Dodge Kahuna Dubya Tee Eff... Ford Explorer Sport-Trac Concept Ford Shelby Cobra Concept Ford GT Pontiac Solstice(duh...) International CXT That is one big fucking pickup truck. Yeah, it has a bed. It gets 8-10 mpg...nice... Chevy Silverado SS Okay mostly it's me pretending I'm driving the Blackjack to it's limits. Ferrari 360 Yeah. A Ferrari. No, I couldn't get in. Poo. Nissan Titan...Frame... Ken grinning about learning the gas tank holds 28 gallons. I kid you not. Mitsubishi Lancer Evo Might I add, this car had AWESOME racing seats, very comfortable. Porsche Carrera S Not the best picture, but oh well. Mercedes SL55 AMG (I'm pretty sure that's what that is...) Chrysler Airflite Hmmph... Jeep Treo It's...a concept car don't worry. I dont know what to make of those "seats". Subaru Impreza WRX STi Mercedes SLK McLaren Mercury Messenger Concept car too. Finally... Mercury Mariner Only the cool people drive those...

I had one of the best nights with friends in a LONG time.  It was honestly fun as hell.  I met Courtney, Bobby, Thomas, and Courtney's friend Malia at Sycamore Commons, then we went to stonecrest, walked around for a bit then met up with Laura and Caitlin.  We drove over to Lisa's restaurant and visited her for a while.  It was honestly the coolest reunion tour.  We went over to Courtney's for a bit and played video games and sat around and...man it was just fun.  I honestly missed those guys.  It's good to be back.  I'm glad I found them as friends again. They really are good, awesome people.  Okay now I'm getting redundant.

On a more sad note, I'm pissed how my grades have gone to shit.  My parents are understandably upset about my study habits, and I understand where they're coming from.  I'm just worried that I won't have the constant availible contact with my friends whenever I want until I prove my grades improved.  Friends keep me here, especially Courtney.  I'm so glad I have her now, everything is falling into place so correctly and perfectly.  All I wish is that my study habits get better so I can better my grades.  My life would be perfect if I could bring home better grades, cause I feel so guilty.  They honestly don't expect much out of me, just good grades.  I can't take advantage of that anymore.

You know I was pretty sad tonight after watching the entire RAW tribute to Eddie Guerrero.  It was the first time in a long time I can remember getting all teary eyed the way those guys were.  These were guys that ate tough for breakfast and took a giant manly dump right after.  There they are, bulging in their shirts, sobbing over this man.  It's pretty amazing realizing whats making these giants cry.  Eddie Guerrero was one of the best men to know, not just in that business either.

Now, I'm in a much better mood.  I talked to Bobby tonight and told him how I felt.  It felt pretty good to get that off my shoulders.  I have a free conscience now and it honestly feels great.  If there were no such thing as pre-lunch on A-days and post-lunch on B-days, life would be great.  Morning news class, weight lifting, lunch with Courtney, photography, then German can be the only class I do quality work and all for...

Oh well keep dreaming.  I can get my license in exactly a week.  Wahoo!

Good night indeed...

<lj-cut text="Wonderful Tonight">
It's late in the evening
She's wondering what clothes to wear
She puts on her make up
And brushes her long blonde hair
And then she asks me
Do I look alright
And I say yes, you look wonderful tonight

We go a party
And everyone turns to see
This beautiful lady
That's walking around with me
And then she asks me
Do you feel alright
And I say yes, I feel wonderful tonight

I feel wonderful
Because I see the love light in your eyes
And the wonder of it all
Is that you just don't realize
How much I love you

It's time to go home now
And I've got an aching head
So I give her the car keys
She helps me to bed
And then I tell her
As I turn out the light
I say my darling, you were wonderful tonight
Oh my darling, you were wonderful tonight
</lj-cut>

Eddie Guerrero died.  One of the rare wrestlers anyone will agree had a big heart.  I know most of you don't care, but this man was more than a muscled violent-head.  He was a loving father and friend of everyone.  You couldn't ask anything more of that man in that business.  He was only 38.  Fortunatly he set the mold for what people should be like, not just wrestlers either.  Why do the good die young?

Talk about a downer to an awesome weekend...
Guess what! Here's that Jeep I mentioned in the last post!

I felt like looking creepy last night. These are unedited webcam shots of me. I'm that ugly. So anyways. These last couple weeks have been particularly stress-free and enjoyable. I picked someone up, got rid of senior exit, and made old friends new again. I got a new cell phone from one of them too! It's purty. Motorola V551 if you want to go Google images/whatever else. We also got an old mail keep because my mom got her job at the Post Office. She starts in a week or two or something like that. For now my dad's getting it here from Texas. The alternator went bad, which powers everything when the car is running, so they had to bypass the headlights. That means he has no headlights. He can't drive in the dark. He has probably 12 hours to go...and he can only drive from about 6am to 6pm. I can't believe how good I felt when I was walking around outside to get the paper. It felt really good and everything. Hooray for donuts, and yay life! One last thing...I painted the grille of my truck black. Check it under the cut.

You are so beautiful
To me
Can't you see
You're everything I hoped for
You're every, everything I need
You are so beautiful...to me

<lj-cut text="I'm your little butterfly">
100 THINGS....

1* First grade teacher's name: Mrs. Lind I think...

2* Last words you said: "Come here Bingo!"

3* Last song you sang: I don't sing much...

4* Last person you hugged: Donut

5* Last thing you laughed at? Donut

6* Last time you said "I'm in love with you"?: not sure...

Tonight was quite possibly the best night I've had ever.  Seriously.  It was spent at a corn maze, then I joined up with my donut and went to a family friend's house for merriment.  He always has a party around Halloween.  It was a bunch of good ole' southern guys, awesome music and excellent barbeque.  And a bonfire my pretty little donut and I pretty much sat at the whole time.  It was the perfect temperature and everything.  The night went absolutely wonderfully.  We walked back to my house for like 30 more minutes before she had to leave.  'Twas the best night ever.  :)  Hope we have many more nights like that...

I thought that was a rather badass picture. OO. An engine. Four barrels of quadra-jet love sitting right there. You little girls with your fuel injection...puh... It's an orange Rolls-Royce. Yeah that's the glovebox. I'll get around to that, don't worry.
I've got a girlfriend.  I won't tell who.  You probably know if you've talked to me recently.  I won't tell you who if you don't know though.

Yeah...so my dad's in the hospital with what they believe to be a minor heart attack.  Sorta scary...but he's a wildabeast.  No fears.

Other than that...life is really pretty good...seems like it's getting better now.
